remarks.para: May be inoperative with AUTO BRAKES light illuminated and autobrake switch OFF provided:

numlitem.para: Module is deactivated in accordance with an accepted procedure, and
Approach minimums do not require its use.
Downgrade aircraft category dispatch status to CAT 3a.

placard.para: Placard the Autobrake Selector panel "SYSTEM INOP" and enter item in Aircraft Deferred Item Log.

maintenance.title: Module Deactivated
maintenance.para: Deferral of this item requires downgrading to the status indicated in the A/C STATUS DISPATCH column below.

numlitem.para: Depressurize the RIGHT and LEFT hydraulic systems.
Depressurize the RIGHT hydraulic system reservoir (ref. MM 29-11-00).
Pump the brake pedals until the brake accumulator pressure gage on the First Officer's panel will reduce no further (approximately 1300 psi).
Open the following circuit breakers on the overhead circuit breaker panel P11 and attach DO-NOT-CLOSE identifiers:
11S14, AUTOBRK ANTI-SKID TEST IND1
11S21, AUTOBRK ANTI-SKID TEST IND2

warning.para: DOOR LOCKS MUST BE PROPERLY INSTALLED PRIOR TO ACCESS TO AUTOBRAKE MODULE (REF. MM 32-00-15). RAPID ACTION OF DOORS MAY INJURE PERSONNEL OR DAMAGE EQUIPMENT IF LOCKS ARE NOT PROPERLY INSTALLED.

numlitem.para: Locate the autobrake valve module located in the left main gear wheel well on the forward bulkhead.
Remove, cap, and stow four electrical connectors D2668, D2670, D2672 and D2674.

note.para: The autobrake valve module may be deactivated and left in place, or it can be removed. Interconnection between the BRAKE and RETURN lines, either through the valve or interconnect tube, is required to prevent leaks.

numlitem.para: Perform step A, or step B.
To disable the autobrake valve module in place:
Disconnect and plug system PRESSURE hydraulic line at module (ref. MM 32-42-09) with a #8 MS plug (steel or CRES material only).
Cap the valve PRESSURE port with a #8 MS cap (steel or CRES material only).
To remove the autobrake valve module:
Remove the autobrake valve module (ref. MM 32-42-09).
Plug the system PRESSURE hydraulic line with a #8 MS plug (steel or CRES material only) (ref. MM 32-42-09).
Interconnect the BRAKE and RETURN lines with a suitable section of tubing or flexible hose (ref. MM 20-10-09).
Remove DO-NOT-CLOSE identifiers and close the following circuit breakers on the P11 panel:
11S14, AUTOBRK ANTI-SKID TEST IND1
11S21, AUTOBRK ANTI-SKID TEST IND2
Restore right hydraulic system power (Ref. Maintenance Manual 29-11-00), and check for leaks.
Restore the aircraft to its normal configuration.
